page.title: 08TEGGS NOSE QUARRY
page.content: A disused quarry forming part of the Teggs Nose Country Park.Quarry bedrock is Carboniferous Sandstone situated at West edge of Pennine Anticlyne.It is a heavily glaciated prominence standing above steepsided valleys on 3 sides.Land covered by heather & bilberry.Tree cover minimal;a few small ash trees in sheltered pockets.Quarry criss-crossed by footpaths for visitors use.As summit of Park,it has 2 viewing points showing views across Cheshire Plain & Macclesfield.Exposed quarry faces used by rock climbers.Quarry Musium has artefacts made from quarried stone & exhibition of quarry tools with diagrams illustrating operations at quarry which closed 20 years ago because high silica content of rock was injurious to quarrymens health.
